title: Getting Started with Next.js
description: Learn the basics of Next.js and build your first app.
content: Next.js is a powerful React framework that simplifies building server-side rendered applications.

title: Understanding the Next.js File Structure
description: A quick guide to folders and conventions in Next.js.
content: The pages directory, public folder, and configuration files make up the core of a Next.js project structure.

title: Understanding Static Generation
description: A look at how Next.js pre-renders pages for speed.
content: Static Generation allows pages to be generated at build time, resulting in fast load times.

title: Optimizing Images with Next/Image
description: Improve performance with the built-in image optimization component.
content: The Next/Image component automatically optimizes images on demand, reducing file sizes and improving page speed.

title: Server-Side Rendering Explained
description: Understand how SSR works in Next.js for dynamic data fetching.
content: With Server-Side Rendering, pages are generated on each request using data fetched from APIs or databases.

title: Client-Side Rendering in Next.js
description: Learn how client-side rendering differs from SSR and SSG.
content: Client-side rendering happens in the browser after the page loads, great for dynamic or interactive content.

title: Using API Routes in Next.js
description: Learn how to build backend endpoints inside your Next.js app.
content: API Routes let you create serverless functions directly in your Next.js project without needing a separate backend.

title: Connecting API Routes to Databases
description: Use Prisma or MongoDB with Next.js API routes.
content: Combine API routes with a database client like Prisma to build powerful full-stack applications.

title: Styling in Next.js
description: Different ways to add styles in your Next.js project.
content: You can style your Next.js app using CSS Modules, Tailwind CSS, Styled JSX, or any CSS-in-JS library.

title: Using Tailwind CSS with Next.js
description: Learn how to set up Tailwind for modern styling.
content: Tailwind CSS provides a utility-first approach that works seamlessly with Next.js for responsive and clean designs.

title: Adding Metadata with Next/Head
description: Enhance your pages with SEO-friendly metadata.
content: Next/Head allows you to modify the head of your HTML document and include titles, meta descriptions, and social tags.

title: Creating SEO-Friendly URLs
description: Make your Next.js routes optimized for search engines.
content: Using dynamic routing and descriptive URLs can improve SEO and help users understand your siteâ€™s structure.

title: Deploying Next.js Apps to Vercel
description: The easiest way to deploy your Next.js project.
content: Vercel provides one-click deployment for Next.js apps, offering fast builds, automatic HTTPS, and CDN caching.

title: Deploying Next.js Apps to Netlify
description: An alternative deployment option for Next.js.
content: Next.js works well on Netlify using adapters that handle SSR, ISR, and static exports effectively.

title: Dynamic Routes in Next.js
description: Build dynamic pages using route parameters.
content: Dynamic routing in Next.js allows you to generate pages based on URL parameters, perfect for blogs or product pages.

title: Nested Routes and Catch-All Routes
content: Next.js supports nested and catch-all routes for flexible URL handling and deep linking.

title: Fetching Data with getStaticProps
description: Learn how to fetch external data at build time.
content: getStaticProps runs at build time and allows you to pre-render pages with data fetched from APIs, files, or databases.

title: Using getServerSideProps for Dynamic Data
description: Fetch data on every request for live content.
content: getServerSideProps runs on the server before each request, making it great for pages with frequently changing data.
